etymology.description: 阴道 + 炎 = inflammation of the vaginal canal.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to inflammation of the vagina or vaginal canal, often due to infection, irritation, or imbalance. Used as a medical diagnosis term.
etymology.simplification: Only 陰 was simplified to 阴, replacing the complex phonetic 侌 with 月 to reduce strokes and echo the ‘moon/yin’ association; 道 and 炎 are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 她被诊断为阴道炎(她被診斷為陰道炎)。
阴道炎可能引起瘙痒和异常分泌物(陰道炎可能引起搔癢和異常分泌物)。
examples.pinyin: Yīndàoyán kěnéng yǐnqǐ sàoyǎng hé yìcháng fēnmìwù.
examples.english: Vaginitis may cause itching and abnormal discharge.

examples.chinese: 医生建议使用抗真菌药物治疗阴道炎(醫生建議使用抗真菌藥物治療陰道炎)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiànyì shǐyòng kàng zhēnjūn yàowù zhìliáo yīndàoyán.
examples.english: The doctor recommended treating vaginitis with antifungal medication.
